document.discussion_title: Russia Box Office: Hollywood Still King, But Local Movies Set to Gain Ground This Year - Movies news - NewsLocker
document.topic_text: via Movies News Headlines - Yahoo! News Disney's "The Jungle Book" ruled the US box office during its second weekend, mauling the competition as it raked in $60. The fourth-biggest movie of the year after just 10 days in release with a total of $191.5 million, the live-action "Jungle Book" continues Disney's hugely successful streak of retelling classic stories, using computer wizardry to bring to life the characters from Rudyard Kipling's tales about a boy named Mowgli who is raised by animals. Starring newcomer Neel Sethi as Mowgli,
